digitalNeuralNetwork.json.title: Digital Neural Network used for Handwriting Recognition
digitalNeuralNetwork.json.projectDescription: A neural network is analogically similar to network of neurons in a human brain, and a trained network can be made to imitate human brain. The network shown in the video has been trained on 5000 hand written numbers and has achieved an accuracy of 97.52%. The image of a randomly selected image from a set is shown on the right side and the most probable prediction is shown in the terminal on the left side

projectDescription.task:
Teams receive a camera view of the control room that contains
       Objects that constitute the puzzle and Obstacles that need to be avoided.
       Images received from the camera have to be processed and commands need to be
        sent to the robot to move it around the control room area. The robot has
        to solve a puzzle by placing appropriate Objects in designated Door Area.
        The image processing part consists of challenges such as shape and color
        detection to distinguish between Objects and Obstacles. The robot has to
        identify and pick up the Objects placed randomly in the control room area
        and place them in their correct Door area in order to solve the puzzle.
        The challenge is to complete this task in the shortest time possible and
         solve the puzzle.
objective: The objective of the Theme is to:

a) Detect the Color
        markers in the Door Area.
b) Find the matching Objects in the Working Area.

c) Use the provided robot to pick the matching Object from the Working Area
         and deposit it in the Door Area, without touching/displacing any Obstacle
         in the Working Area. This has to be repeated till all the matching Objects are
         deposited in the appropriate Cells in the Door Area.

gestureRecognition.title: Gesture Recognition
gestureRecognition.projectDescription:
The C++ (OpenCV library used for image processing)
    program detects 7 hand gestures: the traditional “Yo!” sign, “call” sign,
     “click” sign, “hold” sign, “stop” sign and tilted hands(with degree of tilt)
     with astounding accuracy. It can even be used to control a robotic arm when
      a gesture is detected and made to look like a hand imitator

gridSolver.title: Grid Solver
gridSolver.projectDescription: Grid Solver robot made by Team EmR for IIT Bombay Techfest event.

lowCostIrrigationSystem.title: Low Cost Intelligent Irrigation System (University Design Contest’15 First Prize)
lowCostIrrigationSystem.projectDescription: This project is complete solution for irrigation problem in agriculture.We presented it in University Design Contest organised by ST-Microelectronics and National Innovation Foundation and this project got first prize. Working of this project is completely explained in this video.
